description: SMART Recovery Toolbox - 14 therapeutic tools for addiction recovery

ABC Exercise.description: Rooted in Rational Emotive Behavior Therapy's practice of outlining events to understand them and change behavior

Cost Benefit Analysis (CBA).description: Useful to take a look at the positives and negatives of a behavior

Create a Change Plan.description: Worksheet to identify steps you can take to your envisioned future

Define Your Values (Hierarchy of Values).filename: Define Your Values Hierarchy of Values.pdf
Define Your Values (Hierarchy of Values).description: Provides a structured way to write down your values and focus on what matters most

Disputing Unhelpful Beliefs.description: Guides individuals through identifying and challenging beliefs that might fuel addictive behaviors

Explore New Pursuits and Passions.description: Help identify pursuits and passions that can bring pleasure back into your life

Five Questions.description: Explores how to go about getting what you want with direct guidance questions

Goal Setting.description: Can help build clear and effective goals that connect to your values

Lifestyle Balance Wheel.description: Help understand each area of your life and change perspective where you feel stuck

Personify and Disarm.description: Creates a helpful boundary by personifying urges to make them more manageable

Practice Self-compassion.description: Helps meet tough emotions like shame and guilt with care instead of judgment

Put DENTS in Your Urges.description: Provides an easy way to remember effective ways to manage urges (Deny/Delay, Escape, Neutralize, Tasks, Swap)

Setting Healthy Boundaries.description: Help protect time, energy, and well-being to support long-term change

Urge Log.description: Helps identify when urges occur, see patterns, and understand how to respond in the future
